news_header: The assassination of French teacher Samuel Paty in 2020 sparked national and international outrage, leading to trials for those involved in the attack.
news_text: Samuel Paty, a French history teacher, was assassinated in October 2020 by an 18-year-old Chechen in front of his school after showing cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad during a lesson on freedom of expression. The incident reignited discussions on secularism in France, leading to the trial of eight adults accused of complicity in the murder, with some facing life sentences. The case has raised concerns about the implications for freedom of expression and the effectiveness of anti-terror laws in France. A verdict is expected on December 20.
